frameDefinitions: This frame is concerned with the likelihood of a Hypothetical_event occurring.
A Visitor arrives at the Host_location as a guest of the Host, for the purpose of achieving a Purpose.
This frame characterizes the likelihood that a Hypothetical_event will happen as a position on a scale of impossible to inevitable.
An Agent has a choice of whether or not to participate in some Desirable_event because of an Opportunity, a situation not completely under the Agent's control and usually of a limited duration.
There exist a number of different possible Situations that may happen in the future.
This frame concerns transparent nouns that denote Instances of Types of entities or events.
frameExamples: It is <t>likely</t> that he'll arrive late.
I'm gonna <t>drop</t> <t>in</t> on Kieth for a while.
It would be pleasant in the <t>opportune</t> absence of the clergyman to have a dance . DNI
You have but two <t><fex name='Situation'>choices</fex></t> for your daughter .

The survey confirmed that management interference in team operations had increased , and <t><fex name='Instance'>instances</fex></t> of management decisions being taken without team consultation had also increased .
listRoleDefinitions: The state of affairs or occurrence whose likelihood is assessed.
The <fen>Visitor</fen> arrives at the Host_location to visit the <fen>Host</fen> for a <fen>Purpose</fen>.

The <fen>Host</fen> is the person highly associated with the goal location of the <fen>Visitor</fen>, and who allows the <fen>Visitor</fen> onto his/her territory, and possibly to make use of available resources. The <fen>Host</fen> and <fen>Visitor</fen> and in a host-guest relationship.
The <fen>Host_location</fen> is a place primarily associated with the <fen>Host</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when arriving occurs.
The larger area within which the visiting takes place.
A numerical representation of the probability that a Hypothetical_event will occur.
A metaphorical representation of the position on the scale of likelihood that the Hypothetical_event will occur.
The event that is expected to happen with a certain likelihood.
The situation during which the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen> is possible. For nominal LUs, this is generally in the second layer and contains the target.
The sentient agent that may or may not participate in the <fen>Desirable_situation</fen>.
A situation or event that the <fen>Agent</fen> can participating in during the period of the <fen>Opportunity</fen>.
Something that may happen in the future, or at least whose factual status is unresolved. This is often tagged in a second role layer and generally contains the target.

An individual involved in the <fen>Event</fen>.

'<fex name='Agent'>You</fex> have a <t>choice</t>.'
An entity intimately involved in the <fen>Event</fen>.
A thing or episode of a certain <fen>Type</fen>.
The category of thing or event of which an <fen>Instance</fen> is picked out.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Rain</fex> is fairly unlikely today, I think.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>today</fex>.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>in Seattle</fex>.
There's a <fex>95 %</fex> chance of rain today.
Chances are <fex>slim</fex> that he'll pull through.
He's got a small chance <fex>of making it out alive</fex>.
You have one choice to make <fex>for him</fex>.
I collected two <t>specimens</t> <fex>of this rare species</fex>.

sourceCandidateSpans.text: the "The Secret of Monkey Island: Special edition"
